private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H (A smallest, H larger).
I may only perform moves that move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one.
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so that final configuration is: left peg (top->bottom) D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg (top->bottom) A,B; right peg (top->bottom) C.

private_information: I can move disks: I, J, K, L, M, N, O (I smaller among my set, O largest overall).
I may only perform moves that move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller one.
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so that final configuration is: left peg (top->bottom) D,E,F,G,H,I,J,K,L,M,N,O; middle peg (top->bottom) A,B; right peg (top->bottom) C.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must produce a combined PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards planner.
I must keep each agent's actions distinct in the PDDL and reflect the disk-move restrictions.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem (for FastDownwards) that encodes the combined cooperative plan and yields the required final configuration.

public_information: Classic Tower of Hanoi rules apply: only one disk may be moved at a time, and a larger disk may never be placed on top of a smaller disk.
There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Disks are labeled A (smallest), B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O (O largest).
Initial configuration (top->bottom) on left peg: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O. Middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg (top->bottom) D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg (top->bottom) A, B; right peg (top->bottom) C.

generate_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1: a mover restricted to disks A..H. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, each on its own line, in the exact format: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the public Tower of Hanoi rules and your private disk set. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure each move moves exactly one disk and never places a larger disk onto a smaller one. The full environment public information is provided to you in the prompt.

You are agent_2: a mover restricted to disks I..O. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves you will perform, each on its own line, in the exact format: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the public Tower of Hanoi rules and your private disk set. Do not emit PDDL. Ensure each move moves exactly one disk and never places a larger disk onto a smaller one. The full environment public information is provided to you in the prompt.

plan_pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Your role is to take the move lists from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownwards planner. You must keep the agents' actions distinct (e.g., agent_1-move, agent_2-move) and encode the disk-move restrictions so that only the appropriate agent can move each disk. Provide the PDDL domain enclosed between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. The PDDL should model pegs, disks, sizes, and a move action parameterized by agent, disk, source-peg and target-peg, with preconditions enforcing Tower of Hanoi constraints and agent ownership constraints. Target the FastDownwards planner in any solver-specific comments or requirements.
